title: Telstar 1 Launched
overview: Telstar 1, launched by AT&T and NASA, becomes the first active communications satellite to relay television, telephone, and data signals across the Atlantic.

title: Marisat Satellite Network
overview: The Marisat network provides early mobile satellite communications for the U.S. Navy and maritime industry, laying groundwork for global satcom.

title: Inmarsat Launches Services
overview: Inmarsat begins commercial satellite services, providing global connectivity for ships, planes, and remote areas.

title: Iridium Constellation
overview: Iridium launches its 66-satellite constellation for global voice and data, pioneering LEO networks despite early financial struggles.

title: HughesNet Satellite Broadband
overview: HughesNet begins offering satellite broadband for consumers, providing rural and remote areas with Internet access.

title: O3b Networks
overview: O3b ('Other 3 Billion') launches satellites in Medium Earth Orbit to deliver affordable Internet connectivity to underserved regions.

title: SpaceX Announces Starlink
overview: SpaceX unveils its plan for a global LEO Internet constellation called Starlink, aiming to provide broadband worldwide.

title: Starlink Satellites Begin Launching
overview: SpaceX begins deploying Starlink satellites in batches, quickly building the largest satellite constellation in history.

title: Starlink Beta Service
overview: Starlink launches its beta Internet service, bringing high-speed broadband to rural and underserved regions globally.

title: Amazon Kuiper Approved
overview: Amazon receives FCC approval for Project Kuiper, a planned constellation of 3,200 satellites to provide global broadband coverage.

title: OneWeb Expands Constellation
overview: OneWeb grows its LEO constellation to deliver connectivity to governments, aviation, maritime, and remote communities.

title: Starlink Maritime & Aviation
overview: Starlink expands to airlines, cruise ships, and cargo vessels, transforming in-flight and at-sea Internet connectivity.
